# Helminth Infection and Immune Response {.center}

## *Strongyloides ratti* {auto-animate=true}

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="30%"}
- Rodent-specific parasitic nematode. 

![*Strongyloides ratti* [@VINEY_2017]](assets/images/s.ratti.png)
:::
::: {.column width="70%"}
![Life Cycle of *Strongyloides stercoralis* (Credit: [CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/dpdx/strongyloidiasis/index.html))](https://www.cdc.gov/dpdx/strongyloidiasis/modules/Strongyloides_LifeCycle_19.jpg?_=51499)
:::
::::

::: {.notes}
- L3 infectious stage
- Penetrate skin, migration via lungs, mouth, intestine
- Migration trace: exposure to chitin (material of cuticula)
  - trigger: transcription of IL-33
:::

## Immune Response agianst Helminth Infection {style="font-size: 1.4rem;"}

| **Timeline** | **Infection Stage** | **Immune Response** |
| --- | ------- | --------- |
| Day 0 | - L3 infectious stage <br>- Penetrate skin | |
| Day 2 | - Migrate via skin, lung, to mouth. <br>- Invasion by swallow. | - Eosinophilc and neutrophilic granulocytes.<br>- Fast mast cell degranulation promoted by IL-9. |
| Day 5 | - Reach intestine. <br>- Moult to adult.  | - Fast mast cell degranulation promoted by IL-9. |
| Week 2 | | - Adaptive immune system established. <br>- Production of IgE and IgG, conventional activation of mast cell. |
| Week 3-4 | | - Full eradiction by type 2 response. |
| Post-infection | | - Semi-resistant to subsequent infections |
